org.team5940.robot_core.modules

Class RobotModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • RobotBase
      • org.team5940.robot_core.modules.RobotModule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Module

    public abstract class RobotModule
extends RobotBase
implements Module
    A simple base class that implements Module and runs a single procedure.
    See Also:

      • startCompetition

        public void startCompetition()

      • initializeRobotModules

        protected abstract void initializeRobotModules()
                                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Called on competition start to create all of the modules for this robot. Couple of notes: You can set the robot's logger directly with setRobotLogger(LoggerModule). You can set the procedure to run after this exits with setRobotProcedure(ProcedureModule) or createRobotProcedure(LoggerModule, ProcedureModule, ProcedureModule, ProcedureModule, ProcedureModule). Make sure to start any threads!
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if any fatal exception occurs. Will prevent robot procedure from executing.

      • setRobotProcedure

        public void setRobotProcedure(ProcedureModule procedure)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                              java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Sets the procedure that the robot will run. It will get added to this' dependencies once module initialization is complete.
        Parameters:
        procedure - The procedure to run when initialization is complete.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if procedure is null.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if the robot has already finished initializing.
        See Also:
        createRobotProcedure(LoggerModule, ProcedureModule, ProcedureModule, ProcedureModule, ProcedureModule)

      • createRobotProcedure

        public void createRobotProcedure(LoggerModule logger,
                                 ProcedureModule disabled,
                                 ProcedureModule auto,
                                 ProcedureModule opCon,
                                 ProcedureModule test)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                 java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Sets the robot's procedure to a new ContinuousSelectableProcedureModule named "robot_procedure" with logger, your procedures, forced dependency acquisition, and a new RobotStateSelectorModule named "robot_selector" with logger.
        Parameters:
        logger - The logger you want the new created procedure and selector to use.
        disabled - The procedure to run when the robot is disabled.
        auto - The procedure to run when the robot is in auto.
        opCon - The procedure to run when the robot is in operator control.
        test - The procedure to run when the robot is in testing mode.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if any argument is null. You can use LoggerModule.INERT_LOGGER and ProcedureModule.INERT_PROCEDURE if you don't want it to log or run anything for a specific mode.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if this robot has already finished initializing modules.
        See Also:
        setRobotProcedure(ProcedureModule)

      • setRobotLogger

        protected void setRobotLogger(LoggerModule logger)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                              java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Sets the logger this should use. To be called in initializeRobotModules().
        Parameters:
        logger - The logger this should now use.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if logger is null.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if this robot has already finished initializing modules.
        See Also:
        getModuleLogger()

      • getModuleName

        public java.lang.String getModuleName()
        Description copied from interface: Module
        This is the name for the instance of the Module implementing this interface, it should never change for a given instance. Multiple modules should never have the same name however there is no enforcement mechanism. Module names conventionally are only made of alphanumeric characters and underscores to separate groups of those (e.g. left_shifter).
        Specified by:
        getModuleName in interface Module
        Returns:
        this' name, should never be null.

      • getModuleDependencies

        public ModuleHashtable<Module> getModuleDependencies()
        Description copied from interface: Module
        A module's dependencies are any other modules it directly relies on to do its function. This does not include any dependencies this' dependencies might have.
        Specified by:
        getModuleDependencies in interface Module
        Returns:
        A NEW ModuleList containing any modules this is dependent on. Empty if no dependencies, should never be null.

      • getModuleLogger

        public LoggerModule getModuleLogger()
        Description copied from interface: Module
        DO NOT LOG IN IMPLEMENTATIONS OF THIS METHOD! Gets the current LoggerModule this is using to log. Necessary for silencing this' logger while collecting information for a log (otherwise it's possible to get circular logging) and accessing the logger in default implementations inside interfaces.
        Specified by:
        getModuleLogger in interface Module
        Returns:
        The LoggerModule that the module is using, should never be null.
